H0.text: Sensory neurons carry nerve impulses from sense organs and internal organs to the central nervous system.

H1.text: Vascular neurons carry nerve impulses from sense organs and internal organs to the central nervous system.

H2.text: Autonomic neurons carry nerve impulses from sense organs and internal organs to the central nervous system.

H3.text: Axons carry nerve impulses from sense organs and internal organs to the central nervous system.

A4.text: Sensory neurons, also known as afferent neurons, are in the nervous system which convert a specific type of stimulus, via their receptors, into action potentials or graded receptor potentials.

A5.text: The sensory information travels on the afferent nerve fibers in a sensory nerve, to the brain via the spinal cord.
